text: The 2002–03 Czech First League, known as the Gambrinus liga for sponsorship reasons, was the tenth season of top-tier football in the Czech Republic. ==Stadia and locations== ==League standings== ==Top goal scorers== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Player !Club !Goals |- !1 |align="left"| Jiří Kowalík |align="left"|Synot |16 |- !2 |align="left"| Václav Svěrkoš |align="left"|Baník Ostrava |align=center|14 |- !3 |align="left"| Aleš Pikl |align="left"|Viktoria Žižkov |align=center|11 |- !rowspan="2"|4 |align="left"| Libor Došek |align="left"|Brno |rowspan="2"|10 |- |align="left"| Tomáš Došek |align="left"|Slavia Prague |} ==See also== * 2002–03 Czech Cup * 2002–03 Czech 2. Liga == References == * ČMFS statistics Category:Czech First League seasons Czech 1
title: 2002–03 Czech First League
